statement.tex:
\text{Discuss the continuity of the function f,\\ where f is defined by}\\
\begin{cases} 3, \, if \, 0\leq x \leq1\\ 4, \, if \, 1\lt x \lt3\\ 5, \, if \, 3\leq x \leq10\\ \end{cases}

step.context: \text{What is the condition for continuity at}\\ \text{ x = 1?}

step.tex: f(x) \text{ is a straight line for }x\ne1,3 .\\ \text{Hence, it is continuous for all }x\neq 1,3.\\ \text{But we need to check for continuity \\ at x=1,x=3.}
step.reason: \text{Since, at x=1 the definition of the\\ function changes. So, x=1,3 is the only \\ problem point.}\\ \therefore\text{ we need to check continuity at x =1,3.}

step.tex:
\lim_{x\to 1^-}f(x) = 3\\ \lim_{x\to 1^+}f(x) = 4 \\ f(1)=3\\
\lim_{x\to 3^-}f(x) = 4\\ \lim_{x\to 3^+}f(x) = 5 \\ f(3)=5\\
\\ \therefore \text{f(x) is discontinuous at x=1 and x=3.}\\
step.reason: \text{Since, f(x) is continuous at }x \neq 1,3\text{(step2)}\\ \text{So,x=1,3 are the only points of discontinuity}\\

choices.tex: \text{f(x) is discontinuous at x=1 and x=3}
\text{f(x) is discontinuous at x=3 and x=10}
